name: Inov-8 Bare-X Lite 150
description:
When we were looking for a brand that would help people transition gradually to a more natural running style, Inov-8 was our first choice. Their range covers the gamut of minimalist shoes from 'dipping your toes in' to full-on zero drop barefoot, and their 'Shoc Zone' arrows system gives a rating of how much cushioning the shoe offers and what the differential is between heel and forefoot.

The Bare-X Lite 150 is the lightest shoe in the road range - it's a zero drop shoe but some cushioning is provided through the 7mm EVA midsole. As triathlon enthusiasts, we love the one-piece upper and quick lace system. The sole is a mix of rubber and EVA foam for lightweight durable grip on hard surfaces.

Details:
  • 0mm differential between heel and forefoot
  • Anatomic fit, allowing toes to spread
  • One-piece upper with integrated lacing system
  • Breathable mesh upper
  • Inov-8 Shoc Zone 0 shoe
  • British brand
    • Weight:

    150g

    Can't find your size? Email us

name: Correct Toes
description:
Correct Toes are a unique toe-spacing product designed to guide toes back to their natural alignment – preventing and correcting many foot problems common in runners and non-runners alike, from plantar fasciitis to hallux rigidus. Invented by a podiatrist, Correct Toes can be worn barefoot or inside any shoes with sufficient room in the toebox. (All the shoes we stock are roomy enough to accommodate Correct Toes.)

Sam wears her Correct Toes for running, walking - even sleeping - and has noticed significant improvement in her toe alignment, mobility and foot circulation. They played a big role in ridding her of stubborn plantar fasciitis - follow this video link to find out how Correct Toes can help with this common runner ailment http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7rin6PzWQCs

Many elite runners are discovering the benefits of Correct Toes, too:

‘Correct Toes were an important part of my rehab program coming back from foot surgery and I continue to use them in training.’ Evan Jager, US Steeplechase national recordholder - 6th in the London Olympics steeplechase final

‘Correct Toes are a great product and I like wearing them because they make my stride more efficient and powerful.’ Matt Tegenkamp, competitor in the London Olympics 10,000m final

‘I feel more balanced when I put Correct Toes on, and my feet feel stronger.’ Lisa Uhl, competitor in the London Olympics women's 10,000m

The Emperor's New Shoes is the only UK supplier of Correct Toes.

Details:
  • Medical-grade silicone - very comfortable for all-day wear
  • Washable and durable
  • Three sizes available S, S/M and M/L. S is new and suitable for sizes 3 - 4.5 (but use the link to the template to check if S/M is better). S/M is generally suitable for all UK sizes up to men’s size 9.5. M/L for sizes above men’s size 9.5.
  • If you aren't sure what size to choose, follow this link for further advice https://nwfootankle.com/correct-toes/133-sizing
  • Email us for advice if you are not sure what size to choose.

Postage is free throughout the European Union. Can't find your size, or want to place an order from outside the EU (which will incur a postal charge)? Email us

name: Vibram Fivefingers Bikila LS Ladies
description:
In our humble opinion, this is the jewel in the Fivefingers crown, both looks wise and in terms of comfort and performance. It has a running-specific sole construction and the asymmetrical closed lacing system ensures it fits like a glove. Great on road and dry trails.

Details:
  • Closed quick lacing system
  • ultra thin sole (3-4mm, thickest under the ball of the foot)
  • machine washable
  • padded collar
Weight:

139g

Can't find your size? Email us

name: Real Women Run
description:
Written by Emperor's New Shoes co-founder, Sam Murphy, this book is for women runners of all abilities - from the virtual runner who hasn't actually got round to getting their trainers on to the experienced runner lacking motivation and at risk of grinding to a standstill. Practical and inspirational, this book will show you how to fit running into your everyday routine as well as encouraging you every step of the way. Backed by scientific research, expert advice and the experiences of female runners, Sam shows you how to stay motivated, how to assess and improve your form, the best food and drink for maximum energy, the optimum stretches for top results and how to keep your programme balanced, realistic and challenging but, above all, fun.

Details:
  • 208 page softback book with colour photography throughout
  • The latest on running form, shoes and barefoot running
  • Includes beginner, 5km and 10km training programmes
  • Fully photographed core, strength and flexibility workouts
  • Signed/dedicated copies available! (Non-refundable)

'Murphy manages to inspire, entertain and inform.' Time Out

name: Personal safety alarm
description:
We have hand-picked this personal safety alarm for 3 reasons. Firstly, it is very lightweight (25g) - an important consideration for runners. Secondly, it is very, very loud (100 ear-piercing decibels). And thirdly, it has two smart design features which make it more practical than many comparable products. One is the 'on/off' switch, which means you don't run the risk of it going off accidentally in your pocket or bag. The other is the 'captive' pin, which ensures it can't be dropped or lost. The alarm is made from robust ABS Plastic (riot shield material) encased in a sponge outer for comfortable carriage. It can be attached to clothing or a bag via a karabiner-style clip or Velcro loop if you don't have an accessible pocket. It also has a reflective strip for visibility. A must for anyone who runs (or walks or gets public transport, for that matter) on their own.

Details:
  • Available in blue or yellow
  • Takes 3 x LR44 batteries (included)
  • Emits 100 decibel siren
  • Dimensions 60mm by 30mm

name: VIVOBAREFOOT Training Clinic Metronome
description:
A shorter, quicker stride comes naturally with good running form. Elite athletes tend to have a stride of over 180 steps per minute, rather than the 160 typical of recreational runners. This clip-on metronome (with a bleep or vibrate option) reminds you to keep your stride short, quick and light when running - and is also ideal for drills.

Details:
  • Adjustable tempo from 30-250bpm
  • Adjustable volume
  • Vibrate option
  • Lightweight clip-on
  • Battery included

name: Inov-8 Road-X 255
description:
When we were looking for a brand that would help people transition gradually to a more natural running style, Inov-8 was our first choice. Their range covers the gamut of minimalist shoes from 'dipping your toes in' to full-on zero drop barefoot, and their 'Shoc Zone' arrows system gives a rating of how much cushioning the shoe offers and what the differential is between heel and forefoot.

The Road-X 255 is a great starting point on your journey to more natural running, with a 9mm differential and EVA midsole for cushioning coupled with a roomy toebox and flexible sole to help you find your feet. These were a crucial shoe in Jeff's transition to barefoot - he still swaps his barefoot shoes for these sometimes if he fancies a change of footwear. The Inov-8 Road-X 255 is a men's shoe - the women's equivalent is the Road-X 238.

Details:
  • 9mm differential between heel and forefoot
  • Anatomic fit, allowing toes to spread
  • Endurance sole for durability
  • Dynamic Fascia band on the outsole mimics and supports the plantar fascia
  • Inov-8 Shoc Zone 3 shoe
  • British brand
    • Weight:

    255g

    Can't find your size? Email us

name: Inov-8 Road-X 233
description:
When we were looking for a brand that would help people transition gradually to a more natural running style, Inov-8 was our first choice. Their range covers the gamut of minimalist shoes from 'dipping your toes in' to full-on zero drop barefoot, and their 'Shoc Zone' arrows system gives a rating of how much cushioning the shoe offers and what the differential is between heel and forefoot.

The Road-X 233 represents the 'middle road' of the Inov-8 shoes we stock, with a 6mm differential and some EVA cushioning in the midsole. It's a great stepping stone - or compromise - between a traditional trainer and a minimalist one for road and hard-packed trails. It ticks all our boxes, being light, flexible and roomy in the toebox.

Details:
  • 6mm differential between heel and forefoot
  • Anatomic fit, allowing toes to spread
  • Sticky sole for optimal grip in wet conditions
  • Dynamic Fascia band on the outsole mimics and supports the plantar fascia
  • Inov-8 Shoc Zone 2 shoe
  • British brand

name: Inov-8 Road-XTreme 178
description:
The Road-XTreme 178 takes runners to the next level of minimalism with a 3mm heel-to-toe differential and a pared-back EVA outsole with grip-enhancing sticky rubber only where it is needed. There's plenty of room in the toe-box (Sam wears hers with her Correct Toes toe-spacers) and the tongue is integrated on one side for a snug, clean fit. You'll feel like you are wearing a racing flat, but with better flexibility, ground feel and comfort.

When we were looking for a brand that would help people transition gradually to a more natural running style, Inov-8 was our first choice. Their range covers the gamut of minimalist shoes from 'dipping your toes in' to full-on zero drop barefoot, and their 'Shoc Zone' arrows system gives a rating of how much cushioning the shoe offers and what the differential is between heel and forefoot.

Details:

  • Anatomic fit, allowing toes to spread
  • Single-sided entry for better fit with no rubbing
  • Mixed mesh breathable upper

name: VivoBarefoot Evo II Ladies
description:
Jeff's go-to shoe for road and dry trail running. He's won road races in these, knocked out 15-mile training runs and VO2 max sessions on the track. These are as pure as a running shoe can get - no need for socks, just a puncture-resistant sole and lightweight hydrophobic mesh upper.

Details:
  • 5mm ultra thin puncture-resistant sole
  • Recycled rubber sole
  • Wide toebox
  • Non-toxic hydrophobic upper
  • Removable 5mm insole for optional thermal protection
Weight:

158g

name: VivoBarefoot Neo Junior
description:
Just like the adult version, but for smaller barefoot adventures. These breathable, lightweight shoes allow a child's foot to move – and grow - naturally - with a wide toe-box, flexible sole and no unnecessary arch support. Suitable for all day play as well as running-based activities.

Details:
  • Ultra thin 5mm puncture-resistant sole
  • Hydrophobic upper
  • Toeguard for durability
  • Multi-terrain rubber outsole with directional grip
